branches.name: feature/weighted-edits
branches.rationale: To enhance similarity scoring by allowing certain character substitutions to count differently in edit distance calculations.

commits.title: Implement distance_with_weights method
commits.body: Added a new method to calculate edit distance with weighted character substitutions.

commits.title: Expose distance_with_weights in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new distance_with_weights method.
per_file_changes: Added distance_with_weights to the module exports

commits.title: Update documentation for distance_with_weights
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include usage examples and details for the new method.

branches.name: feature/output-edit-operations
branches.rationale: To provide detailed insights into the edit operations performed during distance calculations.

commits.title: Implement distance_with_ops method
commits.body: Added a new method to return the edit operations performed during distance calculations.

commits.title: Expose distance_with_ops in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new distance_with_ops method.
per_file_changes: Added distance_with_ops to the module exports

commits.title: Update documentation for distance_with_ops
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include usage examples and details for the new method.

branches.name: feature/max-distance-cutoff
branches.rationale: To improve performance by allowing the distance method to return early for inputs exceeding a specified threshold.

src/Levenshtein/levenshtein_cpp.pyx: Implement distance(s1, s2, max_dist=N) and similarity(s1, s2, max_dist=N)
src/Levenshtein/__init__.py: Expose new methods in the API

risk_notes: Ensure backward compatibility with existing methods

commits.title: Implement distance and similarity with max distance
commits.body: Added new methods to calculate distance and similarity with a maximum distance cutoff.
per_file_changes: Implemented distance(s1, s2, max_dist=N) and similarity(s1, s2, max_dist=N)

commits.title: Expose new methods in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new distance and similarity methods.
per_file_changes: Added distance and similarity with max distance to the module exports

commits.title: Update documentation for new methods
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include usage examples and details for the new methods.
per_file_changes: Added documentation for distance and similarity with max distance

branches.name: feature/unicode-grapheme-clusters
branches.rationale: To ensure multi-codepoint characters are treated as single units in distance calculations, improving correctness.

src/Levenshtein/__init__.py: Expose grapheme support in the API

commits.title: Add use_graphemes parameter
commits.body: Added an optional parameter to support grapheme clusters in distance calculations.
per_file_changes: Added use_graphemes=True parameter to relevant methods

commits.title: Expose grapheme support in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new grapheme support.
per_file_changes: Added grapheme support to the module exports

commits.title: Update documentation for grapheme support
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include usage examples and details for the new parameter.

branches.name: feature/multi-threaded-batch
branches.rationale: To allow faster processing of large lists of strings for similarity ranking through parallel computation.

commits.title: Implement batch_distance method
commits.body: Added a new method to compute distances in batches using multiple threads.

commits.title: Expose batch_distance in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new batch_distance method.
per_file_changes: Added batch_distance to the module exports

commits.title: Update documentation for batch_distance
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include usage examples and details for the new method.

branches.name: feature/pure-python-fallback
branches.rationale: To maintain functionality on platforms where the C extension cannot compile, enhancing portability.

commits.title: Implement fallback module
commits.body: Added a pure-Python fallback module for compatibility.
per_file_changes: Implemented fallback logic for non-C extension platforms

commits.title: Automatic selection logic for fallback
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include logic for selecting the fallback module.
per_file_changes: Added automatic selection logic for fallback module

commits.title: Update documentation on fallback module
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include details on the fallback module and its usage.
per_file_changes: Added documentation for the fallback module
